review_comment:
This movie was as enjoyable for a 3 year old as it was for a 63 year old. Abominable takes the themes of grief, hope and family and magically transforms them to take the viewers on an epic journey through Chinese culture. Infused with music, language, landmarks, customs, spirituality and traditions, Abominable makes viewers feel like they are on the journey right alongside Everest and his newfound friends.
With a slew of witty one liners, heartfelt moments and magic-infused hilarity, this film plays like a Concerto of a young girl trying to help a lost creature find his way home, and in turn, finding her own way back home as well. Fresh and original, absolutely one of the best animated films of the decade.

I went to see this movie at the world premier at TIFF. It's a funny, emotional, and enjoyable film perfect for young and adult audiences (I cried like a little child with all the beautiful meanings of this story). Go see it!

Dreamworks has been hit or miss when it comes to releasing great animated films over the years. Whether it's Shrek or Kung Fu Panda, there some truly great movies out there, but I once How to Train Your Dragon hit theatres, and each of its consecutively great sequels, I found myself wondering if the studio had peaked with that trilogy. Well, Abominable is their latest upcoming release, and after seeing it at the Toronto International Film Festival, I can confidently say that this is surprisingly one of the very best animated films that they have released, ever.
Everyone knows that the creature known as the Yeti has been known to be a myth, but in Abominable, a young girl (Yi) finds that one actually exists. Having been experimented on in laboratories until escaping and finding its way onto this girl's roof, she befriends him and makes it her mission, along with two other friends, to return him to his home on mount Everest. This particular story has been told hundreds of times, but unlike many movies that choose to copy and paste formulas, Abominable is one that truly cares about the characters and the adventure they go on, which had me falling in love with it as it progressed.
Having written the story for Monster's Inc., worked in the animation department at Pixar on Toy Story and Toy Story 2, eventually directing her first animated feature in Open Season, and now officially writing and directing Abominable, completely bringing her full vision to life, Jill Culton is one with a storied career, albeit not massive. After her outing here, I must admit that I will be following her work for years to come because I believe her vision and how it was showcased, was honestly fantastic. On top of that, Dreamworks has been on a roll with incredible animation, and this movie is nothing shy of fitting that description.
It should go without saying nowadays that most films released by large studios will probably hire the best of the best to create the most beautiful animation, but I just have to commend them here as well. The smooth motions of characters and the detail put into the wide landscape shots are all superb, and these elements are only elevated by a very enjoyable cast of characters, on an adventure that eventually had me in tears. If for nothing else, you'll probably enjoy looking at this movie, but it has much more than that to offer.
In the end, Abominable does suffer from feeling familiar at first glance, but this movie embraces that and creates a journey that feels fresh. The themes throughout this film are meant for all ages, which is why I believe this movie will be a hit with families across the world when it hits theatres. I wasn't exactly jumping out of my seat with excitement when the trailers for this movie first began to circulate, but after experiencing it for myself, I must say that Abominable definitely surprised me in ways that I wasn't expecting. This is a great animated film and it deserves attention when it hits theatres.

This movie had no more substance than its admittedly appealing visuals. The story is as unoriginal as it comes. Its setting in China is transparent: no more than a coat of Chinese paint over a western culture (and an advertisement for western tourism in China).
Love this movie. great for adults and kids. I would highly recommend it. Go watch it!
It's rude to let the cow's tongue line encroach Vietnamese territory appear in the film

review_title: A Film with a BIG Heart
review_comment:
Abominable is a gorgeously animated film that should delight all children (and a lot of adults) with its stunning animation, original storyline and heartfelt messaging.
All aspects of the animation process are seamlessly meshed in this film, and the end result is an extraordinary animated feature. A pleasing storyline, great character designs including the lovable "Everest", visually mesmerizing backgrounds and skillful cinematography, ensure that this film should delight most audiences, of all ages.
All the sequences be they, the skyscrapers of urban Shanghai, or the rivers and mountains of rural China, are breathtaking beautiful and intrinsically detailed. The film is a delight to watch. I found it charming and visually pleasing on so many fronts. The musical score is a perfect accompaniment to the animation. It is patently obvious that this project is close to the Writer and Director, Jill Culton's heart.

review_title: I'm asian and this is one of my favourite movies.
review_comment: I did know about Yeti before and my dad is from China. This is why I really appreciate how this movie was created. It's one of the most beautiful movie. The plot is really nice. The characters look so cute. The music is really good especially the song that the main character plays. I felt relaxed and happy after watching this. :)

The movie had a decent (predictable) premise, however the actual execution of the movie and its story has so many holes that it loses all viability. The movie lacks creativity, is full of cliche and formula storyline, and is generally a waste of time.
I went into the movie with medium expectations, came out disappointed with the movie.
3-8 year old girls with an interest in violins may enjoy this movie.

I went to see this with my daughter, I went in not really knowing what to expect from the movie and left so touched by just the messages in the movie. The humor was great and hearing all the children constantly laughing made my evening. It was fantastic! IF I had to pick a CON, at first I thought the beginning was dragged out, but it is needed in my opinion for the rest of the movie, where it all fits in!!! Great movie! will be buying when its released.

I went into this movie not knowing much about it. I'd seen no commercials or advertisements for it except for one trailer. I needed to get my 4-year-old out of the house for a few hours, and I knew this would be a great movie for him. I ended up loving it just as much as he did, maybe even more! I laughed, I cried (well, one tear) and I left the theater wanting to give Everest a big hug.

I have watched it three times so far. Abominable is heart touching story, with stimulating visuals and mellifluous music. It is a simple yet powerful movie and with a story that takes you on a journey.
Seriously though this is the best children's movie. No monsters or other scary characters. Definitely a feel good and very enjoyable movie. Beautiful and heartfelt
This is the best animated movie I have seen this year. It is a perfect mixture of fantasy, comedy, and family story. Be sure to take your kids.
Wow wot a movie!! Just loved it, animation is just amazing to watch!! Visual spectacle at its best ???? Kudos to the team for their efforts, brilliant and outstanding movie ????

"Abominable" is a perfect family animated film to watch, it'll make you laugh, and cry in every moment. It brought the Magic to Everest, almost like Disney would do. One of my favorite characters are Yi, and Everest, because he's so cute and they both can do magic. For me it's like watch "Bumblebee", all over again, but in a different way. It's a 'Beautiful Life" to enjoy the "#1 Movie in the World", and it's so much better than "How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World".

review_title: Great movie for the whole family
review_comment: If you want to see an original story that's great for all ages, then this movie is worth the ticket. See it in 3d if you can!!!
The storyline is orthodox, but the devil is in the detail. I would highly recommend this movie. The graphic and the ideas are just amazing.

review_title: The best animated film of the year!
review_comment: The best animated of the film of the year. So emotional and true to life on so many levels. This is what cultural diversity is all about. What a great film to watch for kids and adult alike.

Abominable tells the story of Yi(Chloe Bennet). Yi finds a Yeti on her roof and goes on an adventure to return the Yeti, to his family.
Abominable is a fantastic film. Writer-director Jill Culton has given us a movie, with plenty of adventure set pieces, hilarious, heartwarming & emotional scenes, all rolled into one. The animation is gorgeous. The 3D further engrosses you, in the proceedings of the movie. The Yeti is absolutely adorable. The voice-over work is unforgettable. Chloe Bennet is spectacular as Yi. Albert Tsai is brilliant as Peng. Tenzing Norgay Trainor is awesome as Jin. Joseph Izzo is outstanding as Everest. Eddie Izzard is awesome as Burnish. Sarah Paulson is excellent as Dr. Zara. Tsai Chin & Michelle Wong are superb as Nai Nai & Yi's Mom, respectively. The supporting cast is great. Abominable is a must watch, with your entire family. You will leave the theater, with a big smile on your face.

As a fan of anime, this is an amazingly looking film from an Chinese company. Obviously DreamWorks distributed it, but this is an great start for the studio.
When I saw the trailer attached to the 'live-action' Dumbo remake and had no interest in seeing it. But I went to watch it with a group of friends, and we really liked it. I tend to disagree with some things my friends would say, although I will say this: it is a better looking DreamWorks film since, How To Train Your Dragon. If Pixar has gotten better with CGI, than this proves that DreamWorks can improve on their art. Whether it's made to look cartoony or realistic, this studio will still make some good material with great messages for kids. Even if some are hit and mess.
If you are Asian, or not (not being racist) this a recommendation for all.
P.S. when I say an anime, I mean it looks right out of a Miyazaki film.
Good movie for kids great in 3d cool music and great scenery both kids and parents would like this movie
Well done animation!! Besides sending good message in the movie, also introduce Chinese culture, cuisine and beautiful country.
Me and son loved this movie please make more of this it was very funny and remarkable

Very moving and cute. Highly enjoyable. Needs be taken at face value; it seems there is somebody polluting the reviews here because they feel this is Chinese propaganda. That's a shame; this movie isn't interpretated that way by 99,999% of the viewers and targeted audience.
Recommended!
Quite disappointed to see all the political crap being brought into this. I thought it was brilliant , my daughter loved the film, it was emotional and brilliant and such an uplifting film.

I saw DreamWorks's next big movie, Abominable at AMC Palisades 21 with my mom. It was the third animated film to feature a yeti after Smallfoot and Missing Link. My favorite part of the movie is when Yi is playing with her magic violin to do magic with Everest the Yeti, The funniest parts of the movie is when Peng plays with Everest and Jin running around. I laughed at these parts! And the most emotional parts are when Yi plays the magic violin when they made it to Beijing and the kids saying goodbye to Everest. It was so sad I cried for a bit.
So, Please go see that movie! It's so great and emotional! And don't let the yeti come to your house! I give this movie 10.8/10.9.

Me and my wife really enjoyed this film but my 4 year old son was not much interested in it till the very ending
very nice visuals nice story great screen play totally loved it in isense and the with the sound quality it was a amazing experience i would really recommend this film because its for everyone of any age

The movie is visually satisfying and inspiring! Maybe this is not the best DreamWorks movie but it's definitely worth spending time and money. It has many wonderful moments. Don't be too critical, enjoy it, and this beautiful movie will warm your heart as it did mine.

review_comment: When it comes to releasing great animated movies over the years, Dreamworks is hit and missed. Whether it's Shrek or Kung Fu Panda, there are some really great movies out there, but I once hit theaters How to Train Your Dragon, and each of its consecutively excellent sequels, I found myself wondering if that series peaked the studio. Okay, their latest release is Abominable, and after seeing it at the Toronto International Film Festival, I can confidently say that this is shockingly one of the best animated movies they've ever produced.Everybody assumes that the beast known as the Yeti is believed to be a legend, but a young girl (Yi) discovers in Abominable that one actually exists. She's been studying in laboratories until she escapes and finds her way to the roof of this man, and she makes friends with him and makes it her mission to return him to his home on Mount Everest along with two other colleagues. Hundreds of times this particular story has been told, but unlike many films that choose to copy and paste formulas, Abominable is one that genuinely cares about the characters and the journey they're going on, which made me fall in love with it as it progressed.Having written the story for Monster's Inc., worked on Toy Story and Toy Story 2 in the animation department at Pixar, finally directing her first animated feature in Open Season, and now officially writing and directing Abominable, bringing her complete vision to life, Jill Culton is one with a storied, though not huge, career. I have to confess that I'm going to follow her work for years to come after her outing here because I believe her dream and how it was presented were genuinely awesome. In fact, Dreamworks was on a roll with outstanding animation, and this film is nothing short of matching that definition.Nowadays, it should go without saying that most of the films released by major studios are likely to hire the best of the best to make the most stunning animation, but I just have to applaud them here. The smooth movements of characters and the details put into the wide shots of the scenery are all excellent, and these elements are only enhanced by a very fun cast of characters on an adventure that finally takes me home. If you're going to enjoy watching this movie for nothing else, but it has much more to say than that. When the trailers for this film first started to circulate, I didn't exactly leap out of my chair with anticipation, but after seeing it for myself, I have to admit that Abominable certainly shocked me in ways I didn't expect.

I have a hard time rewatching movies but with this one I would have no problems. It was a very good movie all around, amazing quality, character development, and music. I would recommend a watch. And woop snake is best character.
